security: Revealing the operational status of LIENVOY-8, including the details of his past security issues and potential renewal, could expose ongoing intelligence operations and compromise sources. Quoting directly: 'If he is still being used, please provide a current analysis of his reliability and comments on any security probelms present in light of his actions and reputation in 1960.'
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of the WN Division to the Chief of Station in Mexico City regarding LIENVOY-8, an agent whose status is unclear after a project review, requesting clarification on whether he is still active and an updated reliability analysis.
summary_one_paragraph: Dated October 31, 1963, this secret dispatch addresses concerns about LIENVOY-8, an agent associated with the LIFEAT and LIENVOY projects. After a recent review revealed uncertainty about LIENVOY-8's termination, the Chief of the WN Division requests that the Mexico City station confirm his current status. The dispatch references a 1960 security issue where LIENVOY-8 requested release and showed disapproval of ODYOKE's sharing of the LIENVOY take. Headquarters requires an Agent Service Record if LIENVOY-8 has been terminated or a current analysis of his reliability and security if he is still being used, considering his past actions.
title: LIENVOY-8
